columns.target_angle: target angle in clockwise degrees from vertical
columns.average_angle: the average gabor angle from INIT and CREATE

run_data_X.description: X coordinates of all presented gabors in pixels where [0, 0] is upper-left corner

columns.1: gabor on the left - this is the target if left side is cued
columns.4: gabor on the right - target if right side is cued

run_data_Y.description: Y coordinates of all presented gabors in pixels where [0, 0] is upper-left corner

columns.1: gabor on the left - this is the target if left side is cued
columns.4: gabor on the right - target if right side is cued

run_data_A.description: Orientations of all presented gabors in 0-360 angles with 0 being 12 o'clock, and increasing counter-clockwise

columns.1: gabor on the left - this is the target if left side is cued
columns.4: gabor on the right - target if right side is cued

columns.target_angle: target angle in clockwise degrees from vertical
columns.average_angle: the average gabor angle from INIT and CREATE

task.description: the task participants run in that block

levels.description: report orientation of a single cued gabor
report average orientation of the three gabors on the cued side
report location of a single cued gabor

cond.description: same as task - can be discarded

cue-side.description: the side of display that was cued

targetAngle.description: the angle of the target gabor in range 0-360 with 0 at 12 o'clock and increasing clockwise. For non-spatial task, target angle denotes just the orientation of gabor which was nominally assigned the role of target, NOT the true target angle.

targetAngle_polar.description: The angle of the target gabor in range 0-360 with 0 at 3 o'clock and increasing counterclockwise. If the task is to average three gabors, then the targetAngle_polar is recoded the average of all three angles, NOT just of the target.

responseAngle_polar.description: the angle of the response in range 0-360 with 0 at 3 o'clock and increasing counterclockwise. This is the only place where responseAngle is saved in any way.

deltaPolar.description: the difference angle between the target and the response  in range 0-360 with 0 at 3 o'clock and increasing counterclockwise

fixated.description: did an eye movement occur during the trial
